Reviews.Title: “If you are cheap like me, a reasonable place to stay in a GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: alisaww
Reviews.Content: London is stupidly expensive. Staying here made the trip a bit more affordable. The rooms were small - we had a double, a twin, and a baby cot (for our 2yo, ahem, baby). And there was barely room to walk. The carpets are pretty trashed. But you can't expect luxury for this price. The breakfast room was fine and hey, there was breakfast. The location is pretty darn unbeatable. Walk to Hyde Park easily, steps from Earls Court tube station, on the edge of the Chelsea - the wealthiest neighborhood in London. Nothing about the rooms grossed me out - were clean if worn. They weirdly seemed to try to add luxury by providing us with approximately 82 little packets of shampoo. Staff were fine, if not overtly friendly. Average place, great location, reasonable cost. We asked for a room on the bottom floor and got one.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel for those who just want somewhere to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Orla23
Reviews.Content: I stayed in St. Mark's for 3 nights in Nov 2011. Stayed in a triple room which was located on the third floor. Please note there is no lift in this hotel yet personally I didn't find this a problem as we only had to carry our bags up the stairs once - on arrival, and then down again - on departure. So it wasn't a huge obstacle as previous reviews make it out to be! Although compact, I found the room cosy with everything we needed for our short stay. It even had a fan which helped a lot when we felt a bit stuffy at night. The normal tea/coffee facilities were present in the room with the addition of a microwave and fridge. The bathroom was also compact but modern, and possibly only recently renovated. The breakfast was very basic but we were aware of this on booking so it wasn't a surprise. We only had breakfast in the hotel on the first morning - basic cereal and tea and toast. Didn't have an issue with queues but others after us had to wait at the door for a table.On the other two mornings we opted to have a lie-in and instead got breakfast in a lovely pub at the top of Barkston Gardens Road called "The Blackbird". The room was provided with new towels and linen each day, and the cleaning lady always greeted us in the hall. Personally, the best thing I found about the hotel was the location. It was approx a 5 minute walk from Earls Court tube station which was great for getting around the city and various tourist attractions. And only a 3 minute walk from M&S and other various shops. For those giving negative reviews it must be reminded that St. Mark's in Earls Court is not a leisure hotel but simply somewhere to sleep at night. We didn't spend much time in the hotel during the day, only slept there at night. If your planning a relaxing trip away in a nice hotel, I'd opt for somewhere more expensive. But in light of this being a budget/basic hotel, it is by far a basic hotel of the highest standard. Knowing we had opted for a basic hotel, I found myself pleasantly surprised at how comfy and clean St. Mark's was, and this is possibly the reason I regard it so much. Ultimately, lower expectations gave rise to a pleasant and thoroughly enjoyable stay at St. Mark's, Earl's Court.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: R0adtripjunk1e
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights at this hotel for a family with three adults and one child. Granted, it was a super cheap price especially for 4 people, however it fell slightly short of the mark. For instance, the breakfast room was too small, and we had to wait to get a seat, but if you time it right you can get in. The breakfast consisted of cereals, orange juice, toast, cold boiled eggs and rubbery cheese. We noticed that the eggs were probably the ones not eaten from the day before too. There was tea and brewed coffee but it was of cheap quality. The hotel staff barely spoke English and couldn't seem to take in what we were saying when I asked for more cups for our room. My main complaint though is that the television in our room was unwatchable. It was a wide, flat screen tv and had 'satellite tv' but only if you speak in Arabic. It was tuned to a small selection of channels that I couldn't recognise. We complained about it to reception but the man just said it was the aerial connection. On our insistance he said he would speak to the manager about it, and try and take a look at it, the next day we noticed we had one of the main terestrial channels but it was snowy, like you were trying to watch using a coat hanger for an aerial. There was a tv in reception which seemed to be tuned into CBBC ok and the one in the breakfast room was tuned into a music channel. So I don't understand why they had aerial problems. Also the fridge in our room froze everything in it within a matter of hours. there was no temperature control on the fridge either. There was a microwave, kettle and sink in our room which was great for preparing some food but no toaster as advertised. The bathroom was modern and lovely, and the beds were comfortable (I slept well) and as the others have said there were plenty of sockets. The room was clean and serviced daily. It even had a telephone but no number for reception was given to call. There was also no welcome pack with hotel information. The hotel was in a quiet, lovely street and close to shops, pubs and restaurants, Earls Court Road and the tube station. This was the best thing about the hotel. Next time I think will pay a little more for better service and basic tv.

Reviews.Title: “Good I'd say..”
Reviews.Author: British_lover
Reviews.Content: A little background information: We decided to leave the comfort of our house and change the setting for 2 nights in two different hotels in London: We went by tube until Earl's Court and then, as we went out of the station, we took right on the 3rd street.(Barkston Gardens Street).It took us approx. 5 minutes to reach the hotel. The street has the Barkston Gardens (green area) at the right and many hotels at the left. There is also a Youth Hostel across the road. As we entered the hotel, it looked like a small but well-designed, welcoming one. The entrance was shining and I was happy to see a hotel well-stocked with useful guides and maps on London. The check-in process was quick, we received the card for our room and..We went inside: Our room was on groundfloor, near the reception. (This has the disadvantage that you might hear the reception phone ringing..Tight sleepers beware!) The room is small, indeed, but we were there to sleep, not to run. And we slept well. The place was clean, the bathroom had a modern look, the room consisted of all what ''WestWalesGranny'' said, plus a flatscreen-TV, a coffeemaker (teabags and coffee included) and a safe. All the things in the room were working and we had enough soaps, shampoo, towels whaterver. Even if they don't have drawers/shelves they have intelligently designed a space to hang some clothes in. As about breakfast..I have nothing to add except what ''WestWalesGranny'' said. We haven't tried the tea/coffee though. P.S. Earls' Court is indeed in zone 1 but check with tfl.gov.uk how much exactly would take you to the places you want to visit. Keep in mind that there are repairs during weekends and Tube lines are partly closed.

Reviews.Title: “Poor marks for St Mark”
Reviews.Author: Rob D
Reviews.Content: St Mark Hotel in Earls Court is not great. Our visit was characterised by very indifferent service, no lift, an abysmal room (cabinets falling apart, filthy carpet, uncontrollably hot shower). The best thing about this hotel is that it is close to better hotels. It is cheap, but you get what you pay for. Almost.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service!”
Reviews.Author: lauz1984Lancs
Reviews.Content: We were not even booked 2 stay at this hotel and were moved here from another 1 we had previously booked. Upon arrival we were slightly early so asked could we put our luggage somewhere secure and were basically told to leave them in the corridoor downstairs unattended but they 'would be fine because they have cctv' when we said we wernt happy with that she assured us that once our room was available she would put our luggage in there (it was still unattended downstairs when we came back ) awful attitude and more interested in her book than to deal with paying customers, Room was ok 4 a quick overnight stay and great location 2 tube but will not be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Low cost and very low quality”
Reviews.Author: Gerhard R
Reviews.Content: The room was incredible small (no wardrobe, no desk, no chair), we had a basement room with a lightwell window, breakfast was also in the basement and very crowed. Bathroom facilities were broken. Staff was friendly. The only advantage is the location (good neighborhood, close to tube, pubs and shops nearby)

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: BeesonFamily
Reviews.Content: We arrived at St Mark hotel after a long haul flight to find that our booking had been muddled upand my teenage daughter allocated a double room in lieu of a twin. The gentleman at reception was happy to rectify this and told us that the next day we would be moved. We were then allocated a room on the very top floor. There are no lifts and getting luggage up and down the unlit stairwell was dangerous and exhausting. The rooms were tiny and a little outdated however the bathroom appears to have had a recent yet sub-standard renovation. The cleaning was regular. The linen was ok. We would have preferred a little more than the top sheet and one blanket but fortunately it wasn't too cold. The hot water as referenced in other reports is hit and miss. The breakfast was an adequate buffet of cereal, toast with preserves juice, coffee, eggs and cheese and the two young ladies servicing the neat dining room were very pleasant. Unfortunately I can't say the same for some of the other front office staff. If you are looking for somewhere to lay your head at night then this hostel style hotel will suit your needs.

Reviews.Title: “what a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Tina T
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms, one was in basement, the other on 5th floor no chance of rooms in closer proximity to each other. Concern that there was a lot of what appeared to be rubbish and dumped items outside the basement and wondered if this was a fire risk? Both rooms were dingy. Timer on lights on stairs allowed insufficient time to make it to the next floor. No offer of help with bags. No lift. Nice shower cubicle, no hot water. No response to request for hot water. No offer of any type of compensation re this. Had to wash in sink with water from kettle. Request to call taxi was refused. Breakfast basic in small canteen setting. Lots of other hotels in same road looked very inviting. Gladly only booked one night

Reviews.Title: “Better than average”
Reviews.Author: BeyondBlame
Reviews.Content: Like most London hotels within this price range, rooms are small. However, the room was efficiently designed and the bathroom had been renovated. Cleaned well. Hot water failed some mornings, which made showering brisk and altogether too refreshing for my taste. One had to wait some time for it to come back. The location is convenient for those travelling from Heathrow, just a few minutes from Earl's Court Station, right and second left on exit. Breakfast is nothing to write home about, but there are pubs with fine full English breakfasts just a stone's throw away. On the whole, some flaws, but still somewhat better than the average London hotel of this price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, that's about it!”
Reviews.Author: Dinkystar
Reviews.Content: Although the staff were pleasant and the hotel was very close to Earls Court Station and a short walk to Stamford Bridge. We paid Â£119 for a pokey room, booked a double and got three twins. ( had a good bathroom with shower though) The room was very warm and un-comfortable, the lighting up the stairs very poor. Would not recommend at all to elderly people or the disabled in any shape or form. Missed breakfast completely, no offer of a wake up call at reception and could not find any information book in our room. Believe at the price and all round quality there are far better options in Earls Court, maybe even the youth hostel over the road for those just wanting to rest their head for the night!

Reviews.Title: “Bad surprises will wait you”
Reviews.Author: JeannySantana
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room and they gave us a twin. And worst: we discovered this after loading two heavy bags by 20 steps (they donâ€™t have elevators). After a conversation with an impolite receptionist, they gave us the right room. The room was very small ... there was no space to leave our bags. The blankets were dirty with hair from other guests! The towels were stained with lipstick and the cups as well! The bathroom is also very small ... very uncomfortable for the bath. The breakfast was terrible experience ... In the crowded hotel, there was a breakfast room that contained only six tables. Result: to eat, we had to face a queue (at least 40 minutes) to discover that the breakfast was too poorâ€¦black coffee, milk, toast made by client (another queue), sliced cheese and ham. This hotel itâ€™s a lie. You canâ€™t believe on the photos or descriptions in the website. You will be so angry and may even have to stay on the top floor without elevator!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: doubleAtoronto
Reviews.Content: We'd stayed 5 days at St. Mark in London which we would NOT have been able to afford had we stayed anywhere else. Yes the rooms are small but its LONDON and the rate at St. Mark is EXCELLENT. If you are expecting larger then be prepared to pay through the nose for it. The hotel is perfectly located at Earls Court which is a very busy part of town, so you are close to the Underground and to pubs, restaurants etc. The hotel is located a side street so its very QUIET! The room was clean and had a small kitchenette (with a fridge!) which is almost impossible to find anywhere else. Bathroom was gorgeous and recently renovated. Continental breakfast was good, providing a light breakfast to start your day. Staff were very friendly. Hotel was quiet. I would definitely stay again if I was in London and would recommend to anyone who wanted an affordable place to stay. My only criticism - they charge 1 pound for 15 mins of internet. Otherwise, I thoroughly enjoyed our stay there!

Reviews.Title: “A week-end in London with relatives”
Reviews.Author: ValeMat
Reviews.Content: We had a very positive experience. The room was very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpfull. Perfect location, very near a tube station and in a nice neighbourhood. The hotel doesn't have a lift so if travelling with heavy lugagge or having problem with stairs it would be advisable to mention it when booking. The breakfast room is a bit small but we were advised on the best time to have breakfast and we weren't effected by it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: matrix1000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight prior to the royal wedding. Was glad as I booked late and got a double for Â£45.00 Stayed in room 24, with is on the top floor, after climbing 8 flights of stairs. This hotel doesnt have a lift. Checkin was prompt, the receptionist looked a bit worried asked for IDs, didnt know this was necessary for locals but hey ho gave it to him. The hotel was easy to find and it was clean. It was obvious that the hotel was going thru renovation by the smell of paint and the odd ladder left lying around. The room was a double but it wasnt the largest. The room was nicely decorated, and the bed was comfortable and the sheets clean. The best part of the room was the bathroom. Nice large shower which was powerful. There was complementary soap/shampoo/body wash etc. The toilet was clean but the sink was very small and odd. When you tired to wash your face the whole toliet area got wet. Another nice feature was the microwave and fridge in the room. Really liked that feature but unfortunately didnt spend long enough to enjoy the facilities. The room also had a fan which lead me to believe that it would get really hot in the summer. In london I never leave the windows open because of the noise. But the nite I stayed it was extremely quiet, maybe because the day after was a public holiday. The bathroom looked new but it was evident that the bathroom fittings was already falled apart but it didnt affect my stay. Breakfast was continental the usual cereals, toast and jams etc but no fruit or crossiants etc. But it was ok. No fresh Jiuces but 'Princes' juices are just as good. The breakfast area was small but we didnt have to wait to get a seat. There are only two toasters so it took a long time to get toast. The staff was pleasant and overall had a good stay. The hotel has Wifi at Â£2.00 per hr. I would actually stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: fritzrl
Reviews.Content: First, some positive things to say about the St Mark hotel: The beds were comfortable, the room was reasonably clean, and the location â€“ close to restaurants, banks and transportation â€“ was ideal. Now the bad: Generally, the front-desk staff seemed uniformly unhelpful, and utterly unconcerned about any issues brought to their attention. The room was extremely small, leaving barely enough legroom to get around the beds and â€˜kitchenetteâ€™, and skimpy facilities to store luggage or to hang clothing. The bathroom was ill-lit under the best of circumstances, but the shaving light over the mirror did not work at all during our 3-day stay. A single unsuccessful repair attempt, initiated only after repeated complaints, had a repair person arriving at the room late on a Saturday evening. Wireless internet connectivity was sporadic at best in our room at the top of the building. Reliable internet access typically required sitting in the lobby â€“ where only a hallway bench was available. Phone calls, even on an emergency basis, are not permitted on the hotel phone, so the only alternative for anyone without a working mobile phone is to find a public phone somewhere on the street. Be aware that cash-only, in advance, is the hotel policy. For those for whom the St Mark is their first stop in the UK, obtaining sufficient cash to be allowed access to oneâ€™s room might pose difficulties, depending on the time of arrival. We did not attempt the hotel breakfast, as we understood from other reviews it was meager and served in a tiny breakfast room. As we walked through the hotel neighborhood in search of an adequate breakfast, we saw a large number of potential hotel properties, one of which we will likely try to reserve on future visits to London. We will not stay at St Mark again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all, very convenient for Earl's Court”
Reviews.Author: John_Kelly123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business with a colleague while attending a trade show at Earl's Court. Rooms are fairly small but comfortable. We booked a twin but were given a triple. Shower was fantastic, woke me up a treat. Breakfast consists of cornflakes/muesli, toast and a bowl of hard boiled eggs that Paul Newman would be proud of. Staff at breakfast were very smiley and polite. Didn't really have anything to ask at reception so can't comment on their helpfulness, seemed ok. Not one for a romantic break but if you're in Earl's Court and you need a decent hotel at a decent price, this will definitely suffice.

Reviews.Title: “Hugely disappointing, two rooms we were given were cramped and had no sitting chair and were badly over-priced.”
Reviews.Author: PDH63
Reviews.Content: Although booked 6 months in advance we had our first of three nights in a single room into which a second single bed had been squeezed. despite this we were not given a discount and offered the double we had booked for two nights. This was also cramped and had no easy chair to sit in - essential for any stay. The newly tiled cramped bathrooms had already badly cracked walls and simply impossible for two at any time, with poor extraction or ventilation. The toilet would not flush properly and although advertising newly refurbished this included further cramping units with a whb and a micro wave. Who really needs one in London? The internet costs Â£1 for 15 mins and the wifi signal is poor in some rooms. The breakfast room seats about 16 and is really big enough for about 8 at most and the tables and chairs are outside pub furniture, so you can expect to queue for breakfast and then be uncomfortable. But it gets worse - the staff took everything away from the sparse buffet at 9.30 even though we had arrived at 9.10 and only when we said this was ridiculous did they reluctantly get some toast out. If you go out for breakfast beware the "full English breakfast" near tube - it is far from full and will cost much more than the Â£5 advertised! All in all you would be best to avoid this so-called hotel which would merit a genuine two star status.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but very small triple room”
Reviews.Author: trudy2410
Reviews.Content: I arrived with my 2 children and was reasonably impressed with the reception. We spent 2 nights in the hotel and I used airmiles to book the triple room. We were initially given someone else's room so had to walk all the way back down stairs to reception and we then got another room, number 16. It was very, very small for a triple room with a tiny double bed and a put-me-up single bed. The bathroom had a very big crack in the floor tiles which could cause a cut if you were not careful. The room had clean sheets and towels and a nice flat screen TV on the wall. When I tried to get to sleep there was a very loud buzzing which we eventually discovered to be the fridge so we unplugged it. There was a lot of noise from other rooms as the walls are paper thin. I asked for more pillows and received them. I had to pay a Â£10 deposit for the remote control for the TV which I thought was odd as I had no desire to nick it!!! The carpets throughout the hotel need to be cleaned, but there was no evidence of rats, or anything else unsavory. Breakfast was poor with cereal, toast, boiled eggs and some very sweaty looking cheese. The toaster had broken so I risked electrocution in order to eat breakfast. The breakfast room was very small and excessively hot. The staff were generally pleasant and helpful. Although there were quite a few things that could be improved it was a very short walk to the tube and it was in a safe street so it served our needs, we did not stay long in the room as we were in London to sight-see.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value But Not Without It's Problems”
Reviews.Author: Barco84
Reviews.Content: Londonâ€™s expensive and â€“having read the reviews on Trip Advisor beforehand â€“ I opted for St. Markâ€™s Hotel as it seemed a bargain at Â£35 for a double room. To put it into perspective, this is less than some grubby central London hostels charge for a room where you share with strangers. On arriving I found if I paid by card thereâ€™d be a Â£3 fee, which isnâ€™t stated anywhere (or at least not clearly). I wasnâ€™t going to give them that privilege so I had to flee outside and find a cash point which was rather inconveniencing, having travelled eight hours and simply wanting to relax in my room! Next, the room. Adequate enough for the price, particularly by London standards, but located directly next to the reception meaning you could clearly hear constant conversations between customers and staff. Luckily for me, I went out to meet my friends and didnâ€™t come back till very late so didnâ€™t have to endure this all evening â€“ wouldnâ€™t have been best pleased if I had to though! The bed was comfy and spacious enough so I slept well. There were tea-making facilities together with a mini fridge and microwave (which I never used), the shower was also great. Television on the wall was a flat-screen which made for enjoyable viewing. Place has clearly been refurbished as it looked quite fancy for itâ€™s price band. Luckily, I didnâ€™t encounter any vermin as some other reviewers have noted! I only hope the staff have rectified this problem. As for the breakfast, what crap. The toaster â€“ which was switched on - was broken but there was no signs stating so, meaning you had to do a risquÃ© DIY technique with your bread using provided tongues. Iâ€™m usually one to make the most of a buffet but the selection was awful â€“ eggs inexplicably lying in a basket, bland cereal, etc. In the end I went to McDonalds. At the time of typing, there were major construction works taking place on Barkston Gardens Road and the drilling echoed loudly in my room as I was directly opposite (number 6). I was going to make the most of my stay and leave at the latest time of 11am but after enduring 15 minutes of this noise made a hasty getaway to avoid a headache! Overall, Iâ€™d give this place 3/5 for itâ€™s value for money but youâ€™re more than likely going to endure a few problems during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “satisfactory stay”
Reviews.Author: Amity_9
Reviews.Content: I booked in smoothly, I was asked to pay upfront which is no problem as long as I see what I'm paying for, I was allocated in a triple room instead of a double. I asked the receptionist about the on and off fire alarm who confirmed it'd not happen as it used to be very sensitive to steam, smoke...etc. I was offered help, but I was ok. The breakfast was in the basement, it was ok. On the whole, I will go again and I will receommend it.

Reviews.Title: “utterly horrible and disgusting”
Reviews.Author: luckymummyto2
Reviews.Content: Bad points - rude and dirty staff -really dirty -awkward building with no lift -there were vermin in the rooms! -the tv didn't work -the cleaners wore dirty clothes and slippers -extremely small, unclean breakfast room -the breakfast was horrible, no variety and left out all morning I really could go on an on.. seriously do not stay here it is disgusting the only good point was the location but in saying that the street was full and I mean full of homeless people sleeping outside the hotel and on several of the mornings there were young men using drugs right outside the hotel door.. so obviously not the safest area in london!

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable, no ambience, won't go again”
Reviews.Author: purplepiscean
Reviews.Content: The location was great, very close to the Tube and in a nice little street. But that's the best to be said about this hotel. Absolutely no ambience and certainly not designed for the comfort of guests. No lift, and no assistance from staff. So its a right pain dragging heavy bags up steps. Our room was so small, there was no where to put our bags. We had a window that overlooked a pile of junk in the yard. No shower screen or curtain between the shower and toilet. Nowhere comfortable to sit. You could sit on the edge of the bed, lie on it or stand. Wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Good”
Reviews.Author: IsaacNY
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there 3 Nights and nothing went wrong, except for the fire alarm which went off late in the night, I was told for faulty reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: LazyKat
Reviews.Content: Our experience with the St. Mark Hotel started off badly but ended ok. When we arrived we were told that there was no reservation for us. There was a misunderstanding with our credit card and instead of trying to contact me about the problem they did nothing. As the man at the check-in desk said "I thought it was a joke." A joke? He didn't speak English that well so arguing with him got us no where. In any case, he did manage to find us a room at their sister hotel down the street, the Oxford Hotel. We came back the St. Mark the next night for the rest of our stay. We were initially put in a room for 3 people with a cot (we were a group of 4). With the cot in the room, the space was very tight, but we managed. We were then moved to a much larger room for 4 people and were very happy after that. The hotel was finishing up some renovations at the time, but this did not bother us. Everything was brand new and very clean (Ikea-like furnishings). The beds were moderately comfortable and no signs of bed bugs. There was a more than adequate bathroom with sink, toilet, and shower in the room, closet space, small table and chairs, and TV with satellite. There was no lift, but we were on the first floor so that did not bother us. Breakfast consisted of self-serve breads, eggs, meats and cheese, coffee, tea, and juice. It was available in the basement with limited seating and a TV. In both rooms that we stayed in, we were not disturbed by other guests making noise. We were however quite disturbed by the fire alarm going off each morning, presumably because of breakfast cooking. All in all, I'd say the hotel was much nicer than others in the area for the same price, but the costumer service leaves a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Rudeness at Front Desk concerning payment method”
Reviews.Author: TEH2
Reviews.Content: My regular Earls Court area Hotel was booked last weekend, so I did a search and found this one as a replacement. Their website accepts American Express cards as a form of deposit, but when I checked in I was rudely told..."we don't accept that card, do you have a debit card?" I replied NO, and asked why the website accepted AmEx for a deposit, if they did not accept the card. The response was ," It doesn't," even through I had in-fact used it. When I presented a Visa Credit Card for payment I was told "there will be a 3% surcharge for using a credit card." I've just recheked their website and there is no mention of any surcharge, nor has American Express been removed as a payment option. In checking my Visa statement on-line today, I find I was charged the quoted rate upon check in - then upon check out was charged the quoted rate plus 3%, resulting in a "pending" charge for the former. I'm watching closely to be sure a "double-bill" isn't being attempted. As others have noted...THERE IS NO LIFT and the rooms are just OK...frankly there are better options, in this price range, in Earls Court. Because of that and the rude treatment at the front desk, I will not be using this property again.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: TimothyGlasgow
Reviews.Content: The time I was planning to book a hotel in Earl's court, I was scared of the comments I've read which I don't think it's helpful to evaluate this very nice hotel. First of all, the staff were helpful, they asked me which floor I like and they offered helping me with the bags as I'm less abled. Their welcome was friendy and warm. Having checked in, the front desk rang to make sure everything was ok. The room was spotlessly clean, the breakfast was more than excellent for a budget hotel.whenever I asked for help or directions, they were always helpful. I will definitely book this hotel the next time and I do recommend it to anybody wants to enjoy a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Just for sleeping!”
Reviews.Author: kurts
Reviews.Content: The St Marks Hotel has a few positive aspects: very close to Earl's Court Road tube station and in a very quiet road - yes, and it was relatively clean! All the rest is terrible: our twin room (#7) was very (really very) small. To reach the second bed was an artistic maneuver. There is almost no space for luggage - and no cupboards. The breakfast (continental) is at a minimum - and the breakfast room is a much too small room for quite a number of guest rooms. No place to sit a bit comfortable - neither in the room nor in the lobby! No athmosphere at all - and they charged for this period 70 Pounds! So rather look for another option!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Marian_H
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. We were both very pleased with our stay. The bathroom was very nice, though small, you had more than enough space for one person. The first morning it was very cold but we discovered the oven under the window had been set to the lowest termostate. After turning i t up it was very pleasant. The breakfast room was small but we were allowed to bring the food to our room when it was full, as long as we brought back the plates. That was only necessary 1 day, the other days we got a table in the breakfast room. The staff was very nice. When asking for an extra blanket since we only had 1 they had one ready for us in our room when we returned later the same day. We booked a double bed since that were the cheapest offer. But we had plenty of room beside the one side of the bed and under the window. There even was a table in our room. We had two suitcases and still room on the floor. Tv didn't have the best quality but it was ok. Only thing I missed was a remote control. The kitchen was very convenient with fridge and microwaveowen. Very easy to cook your own dinner:) Payed 45Â£ for the room. Was worth it. When you find a cheap, 2 star hotel you cannot expect king zize room or luxarius. Stilll it was more than enogh. All in all we had a nice stay:) Will definetly come back!

Reviews.Title: “Will not ever stay there again”
Reviews.Author: bubspark
Reviews.Content: The room for 4 was very small but we were okay with that. However, the staff was very unhelpful. The heater in our room was not working properly and when asked, he directed us to a thermostat in the corridor which we could not reach due to a huge pile of towels on the floor. We had to ask him many times before he finally came up to check on the heater. On the next morning, when we were still in the room, one of the hotel staff turned off the central heater and we were freezing in our room. On top of that, the window could not shut properly and the cold draft could come in. It was a terrible experience and the breakfast was miserable. I will not stay in this hotel again and will not recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: niche001
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with our stay at St Mark Hotel, the hotel was not completed, our room seemed like it was not yet finished and smelled strongly of fresh paint which gave you a headache after too long. Housekeeping did not knock or announce themselves before entering, simply walked into the room. The rest of the hotel staff were very rude. I had come down with food poisoning and was violently sick the whole nite, as such we were running late packing up the next morning so my boyfriend went up to reception to inform them of the situation and to let them know we would be 15 mins late checking out. The hotel staff first got our booking mixed up and angrily accused us of checking out 2 days early, then when they finally got the right booking they told him to "go faster, faster" and hurry up and get out of the room. Finally, when we ordered a cab through the reception they called what I can only assume was one of their friends, as he did not have a meter and charged an exorbitant amount which they did not inform us about before we got into the cab (we also overheard the driver and hotel manager discussing the commission on the fare!). The hotel staff/managers seemed more pre-occupied with fixing their hotel as opposed to running and taking care of their guests. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “st mark hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozzichick
Reviews.Content: We were booked for the York Hotel but due to them double booking us, we were sent to this hotel in nearby street It is clean enough and had adequate breakfast but was in the middle of renovations,resulting in mess and rubbish blocking hallways and severe paint smell Steep stairs- No lifts -so unsuitable for elderly or disabled Staff don't follow up requests for simple things like toilet paper Tiny rooms very stuffy
